title: Kanthale hospital faces surgical crisis amid consultant shortage
byline: Base Hospital Kanthale has issued an urgent plea to the Ministry of Health for the immediate replacement of its Consultant Surgeon, whose recent absence has disrupted critical surgical services and forced the hospital to divert emergency cases to other facilities.

title: Government rules out any plans to offer ministerial portfolios to Douglas
byline: The government ruled out any plans to offer ministerial portfolios to EPDP leader former minister Douglas Devananda.

title: ’Will introduce programme to eradicate drug menace’: President
byline: The government will take steps to eradicate the drug menace and the underworld while putting an end to the insecure situation in the country, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said yesterday.

title: Hamper voting? EC, DMC brace for any disaster on polling day
byline: With heavy inter-monsoonal rain beating the country, the election authorities have decided to work out extra plans along with the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) to conduct polling of the General Election next Wednesday without any impact from a possible disaster situation, an official said.

title: Excessive taxation could undermine economic equity, warns legal expert
byline: President’s Counsel Dr. Shivaji Felix raised critical concerns about Sri Lanka’s Inland Revenue practices, suggesting they may place undue burdens on the taxpayers, without delivering equivalent benefits.

title: Sri Lanka unveils new sustainable tourism strategy to capture UK market at WTM 2024
byline: Sri Lanka presented a fresh vision for its tourism industry at World Travel Market (WTM) 2024 in London, introducing an ambitious sustainability-driven strategy aimed at enhancing visitor engagement while preserving the island’s rich natural and cultural resources.

title: Colombo Tea Auction sees offering cross 6 MnKgs after 5 months
byline: The total auction offerings crossed the 6.0 million kilogramme mark, after a lapse of five months (Sale No. 22 of 4/June 5, 2024).

title: Sri Lanka should consider a One-Stop Centre for Investors – taking Rwanda learnings: MTI
byline: Countries like Sri Lanka should consider conceptualising and developing such an entity, which requires cutting through layers of bureaucracy and legislation, to ensure an almost effortless, seamless investor experience, according to MTI Consulting.

title: Shooting incident reported at Lotus Tower last night
byline: A shooting incident was reported at the Lotus Tower during a musical show last night, police said.

title: Special measles vaccination program launched in 12 districts
byline: A special measles vaccination program kicked off today in 12 districts across Sri Lanka.

title: Sujeewa Senasinghe claims vehicle cleared by government analyst
byline: The vehicle owned by Samagi Jana Sandanaya (SJS) National Organiser and national list nominee Sujeewa Senasinghe has been cleared by the government analyst as being genuine.

title: Will probe killings of Thajudeen, Lasantha: President
byline: The government will investigate into and bring to book those responsible for the killing of peaceful people like Wasim Thajudeen, Lasantha Wickramatunga and the disappearance of Pradeep Ekneligoda, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.
